sent: Nintendo Entertainment Analysis & Development handled the development of Super Mario All-Stars.

sub_label: The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Seasons and Oracle of Ages
sent: The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Seasons and The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Ages are two action-adventure games in the Legend of Zelda series, developed by Flagship (a subsidiary of Capcom).
In July 2011, Genuitec released MyEclipse "Bling," which combines the MyEclipse Blue Edition and MyEclipse for Spring product lines into a unified offering.

FullWrite Professional was a word processor application for the Apple Macintosh, released in late 1988 by Ashton-Tate.
Founded in 2012, OTX was created and is run by AlienVault (now AT&T Cybersecurity), a developer of commercial and open source solutions to manage cyber attacks.
ArcView GIS was a geographic information system software product produced by ESRI.

sub_label: Star Trek: The Next Generation: Klingon Honor Guard
sent: The game was developed by MicroProse in 1998, using the Unreal game engine.

Angry Birds Trilogy is a video game co-developed by Rovio Entertainment, Exient Entertainment, Housemarque, and Fun Labs and published by Activision.

SmartOS is developed for and by Joyent, but is open-source and free for anyone to use.
Turbo C++ was designed as a home and hobbyist counterpart for Borland C++.
ACMS was developed by Digital Equipment Corporation in the early 1980s as part of an effort to gain market share in commercial applications.
Ulead PhotoImpact (originally called Iedit) is a raster and vector graphics editing program published by Ulead Systems.

The Image Packaging System, also known as IPS or pkg(5), is a cross-platform (written in Python) package management system created by the OpenSolaris community in coordination with Sun Microsystems.
Silent Hills is a cancelled survival horror video game developed by Kojima Productions for the PlayStation 4.

Terra Battle is a role-playing video game developed by Mistwalker.

Sonic Mega Collection is a video game compilation developed by Sonic Team and published by Sega in 2002 for the GameCube.

SuperCalc is a CP/M-80 spreadsheet application published by Sorcim in 1980.
SIMATIC WinCC can be used in combination with Siemens controllers.
Netscape 7 is the successor of Netscape 6, and was developed in-house by AOL.
Star Trek: Bridge Crew is a virtual reality action-adventure video game developed by Red Storm Entertainment and published by Ubisoft for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4, and Oculus Quest.
The Amazing Eternals was an upcoming team-based multiplayer online first-person shooter video game developed and published by Digital Extremes.
Snapseed is a photo-editing application produced by Nik Software, now owned by Google, for iOS and Android that enables users to enhance photos and apply digital filters.
Scalebound is a cancelled action role-playing video game being developed by PlatinumGames from 2013 until its cancellation in 2017.
The founders of Chorus Systèmes started a new company called Jaluna in August 2002.
Tru64 UNIX is a discontinued 64-bit UNIX operating system for the Alpha instruction set architecture (ISA), currently owned by Hewlett-Packard (HP).
WordPad is a basic word processor that is included with almost all versions of Microsoft Windows from Windows 95 onwards.

In computing, Java Web Start (also known as JavaWS, javaws or JAWS) is a framework developed by Sun Microsystems (now Oracle) that allows users to start application software for the Java Platform directly from the Internet using a web browser.
World Builder was released in 1986 by Silicon Beach Software and had already been used for creating Enchanted Scepters in 1984.
MonoDevelop (also known as Xamarin Studio) is an open-source integrated development environment for Linux, macOS, and Windows.

FireMonkey is a cross-platform GUI framework developed by Embarcadero Technologies for use in Delphi or C++Builder, using C++ or Object Pascal to build cross platform applications for Windows, macOS, iOS, and Android.

MPLAB is a proprietary freeware integrated development environment for the development of embedded applications on PIC and dsPIC microcontrollers, and is developed by Microchip Technology.

Citrix Workspace (formerly Citrix Workspace Suite) is a digital workspace software platform developed by Citrix Systems that allows multiple users to remotely access and operate Microsoft Windows desktops running in a datacenter or a public or private cloud, via devices located elsewhere.

Zend Studio is a commercial, proprietary integrated development environment (IDE) for PHP developed by Zend Technologies, based on the PHP Development Tools (PDT) plugin  for the Eclipse platform (the PDT project is led by Zend).

Opera GX is a gaming counterpart of Opera web browser for Microsoft Windows and macOS, developed by Opera Software AS.

WPS Office (an acronym for Writer, Presentation and Spreadsheets, previously known as Kingsoft Office) is an office suite for Microsoft Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS and Android, developed by Zhuhai-based Chinese software developer Kingsoft.
Star Trek: Tactical Assault is a Star Trek video game for the Nintendo DS and PlayStation Portable that was developed by Quicksilver Software, also the creators of Star Trek: Starfleet Command.

NekoVM is a virtual machine developed by Nicolas Cannasse as part of research and development (R&D) efforts at two indie video game firms in Bordeaux, France: first at Motion Twin and then at Shiro Games.
Asphalt Overdrive is a 2014 "endless runner" video game published by Gameloft and developed by their Madrid studio.

DaVinci Resolve (originally known as da Vinci Resolve) is a color correction and non-linear video editing (NLE) application for macOS, Windows, and Linux, originally developed by da Vinci Systems, and now developed by Blackmagic Design following its acquisition in 2009.

Universal Scene Description (USD) is a framework for interchange of 3D computer graphics data, created by Pixar.

Internet Explorer for UNIX is a discontinued version of the Internet Explorer graphical web browser that was available free of charge and produced by Microsoft for use in the X Window System on Solaris or HP-UX.

LUnix, short for "Little Unix", is a Unix-like multi-tasking operating system designed to run natively on the Commodore 64 and Commodore 128 home computer systems.

sub_label: Zak McKracken and the Alien Mindbenders
sent: Like Maniac Mansion, Zak McKracken and the Alien Mindbenders was developed for the Commodore 64 and later released in 1988 for that system and IBM PC (MS-DOS).

OpenVMS was first released by Digital Equipment Corporation in 1977 as VAX/VMS for its series of VAX minicomputers.

NOS / VE is a virtual memory operating system, employing the 64-bit virtual mode of the CDC Cyber 180 series computers.
The GM-NAA I/O input/output system of General Motors and North American Aviation was the first operating system for the IBM 704 computer.
